name: Half Frog Pose
setup: Prop upper body on forearms (sphinx pose position)
Bend one knee and bring heel toward same-side glute
Reach back with same-side hand to hold inside of foot
steps: Gently press foot toward glute with hand
Rotate bent knee slightly outward if comfortable
Hold for prescribed time, then switch sides
mistakes: Forcing knee too far (risk of knee strain)
safety: Yin yoga requires patience. If knee feels sharp pain, reduce depth or skip. Use props under hips if needed.

regressions: Lying quad stretch (hand holds ankle, no rotation)
progressions: King pigeon pose (deeper hip and quad stretch)

prescriptionHints.notes: Hold 2-5 min each side for yin practice. Deep quad and hip flexor release.

joints.notes: Be gentle with knee. Keep hips level to avoid compensatory patterns.
